com.mousebird.maply

Class QuadTrackerPointReturn

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.QuadTrackerPointReturn

  • public class QuadTrackerPointReturn
extends java.lang.Object
    You pass in one of these to query where a whole mess of points fall on a group of pages tiles. This is useful for particle systems that read from tiles (like wind tiles).

      • getNumPoints

        public int getNumPoints()
        Return the number of points.

      • setScreenLoc

        public void setScreenLoc(int which,
                         double screenU,
                         double screenV)
        Set the location on the screen for the given sample.
        Parameters:
        which - Which sample to set.
        screenU - X value on the screen
        screenV - Y value on the screen

      • getScreenLoc

        public Point2d getScreenLoc(int which)
        Return the screen location (which you set earlier) for a given sample.

      • getTileID

        public MaplyTileID getTileID(int which)
        Return the tileID where a given sample landed. If level is set to -1, that means it didn't land.

      • getCoordLoc

        public Point2d getCoordLoc(int which)
        Return the location in the local coordinate system. If this is a globe, this is Spherical Mercator.

      • getCoordLocX

        public double getCoordLocX(int which)
        Return the X coordinate in the local coordinate system for the sample.

      • getCoordLocY

        public double getCoordLocY(int which)
        Return the Y coordinate in the local coordinate system for the sample.

      • getTileLoc

        public Point2d getTileLoc(int which)
        Return the location within a tile where the sample landed. This is how you interpolate data values within a tile for the sample.

      • getTileLocU

        public double getTileLocU(int which)
        Return the X coordinate in the tile.

      • getTileLocV

        public double getTileLocV(int which)
        Return the Y coordinate in the tile.
